intro: Ceroxylon floccosum, commonly known as the white-woolly tree, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its dense, white, woolly foliage that covers its entire body, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the dry season. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is often found in high-altitude regions with cool, moist climates. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
